attributes.action: Ban the cruel Glue traps in which Songbirds Kittens & Hedgehogs starve to death.
attributes.background: Glue traps don't just trap rats and mice, they indiscriminately catch any creature which has the misfortune to come into contact with them sentencing them to a lingering death in agony, until they die from starvation. The makers recommend disposing of the live, trapped victim in household waste.
attributes.additional_details:
Glue Traps are already banned Ireland and New Zealand.
Humane Society International have disturbing videos of all kinds of stuck creatures, trying to free themselves from glue traps which cause "hideous and even illegal cruelty” traps which 68 per cent of the British public would support banning. This can be seen at www.hsi.org
 
PETA, People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, have fought these since they first went on sale. See www.peta.org/issues/wildlife/wildlife-factsheets/glue-traps

attributes.action:
Impose legal regulations on the use of digitally altered images
in the media.
attributes.background:
This use of digitally altered images of persons in all broadcast & non-broadcast media should be more heavily regulated.

The only alterations to be permissible under law are elements that are temporary in nature (for example a blemish/bruise etc) and such alterations should be disclosed.
attributes.additional_details:
Any alterations that modify the size and proportion of a model should be prohibited.

This is to ensure that a model's physical appearance is not artificially manipulated, including their weight, shape and size. 

If such acts are carried out, the offending party should be awarded
with a large fine.

Photoshop should be used in a sophisticated manner, and images promoted to the public should encourage a realistic and healthy body image.

attributes.action: Abolish the role of the Mayor of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough
attributes.background:
We the people of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough simply wish for the role of Mayor of Cambridgeshire & Peterborough to be abolished.

The hard working tax-payers of the above said, do not wish to fund a Mayor and a Mayors office in all its entirety...

attributes.action: Legislate that cyclists & bicycles are tested, taxed, insured and registered.
attributes.background: The government must legislate to bring cyclists in line with other public road users. Therefore, cyclists should pay for and take a competency test, be issued with a license, be issued with two registration numbered Hi-Viz jackets, be insured and pay road tax.
attributes.additional_details: Following a recent death involving a bicycle, cyclist deaths caused by lack of awareness and continuing reports in the media of cyclists contravening red lights and pedestrian crossings, we must bring cycles under control and bring in a regime of culpability. If you want to cycle on public roads you should behave by and be governed by the rules and regulations of the road and you should pay for that priviledge, just as other road users have to.

attributes.action: Amend Universal Credit so that weekly paid workers aren't unfairly disadvantaged
attributes.background: Universal Credit may be stopped for weekly paid workers in a 5 week month, and they will have to reapply. This discriminates against weekly paid workers. Those paid the same annual wage over 12 months will not have months without Universal Credit payment or the stress of reapplying 4 times a year.
attributes.additional_details: For further details of this aspect of Universal Credit see condition 8 for weekly paid workers, and condition 7 for fortnightly paid workers. https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/universal-credit-different-earning-patterns-and-your-payments/universal-credit-different-earning-patterns-and-your-payments-payment-cycles#if-youre-paid-weekly

attributes.action: Make battery farming of livestock illegal and only allow free range farming
attributes.background: There are hundreds of battery farms in the UK that force animals such as Chickens to live in cramped, inhumane conditions where they can barely move. This causes a huge amount of suffering to animals who are not allowed to live in their natural environment.

attributes.action: Give inshore fisherman (non-sector & under 10m boats) 30% share of the UK quota
attributes.background: The inshore fishing industry should be legally entitled to 30% of all UK quota. The current system is based on historical quota allocation which is grossly unfair.
attributes.additional_details:
Under 10m boats make up 77% of the UK fleet but their quota pool only accounts for 1.5% of the national Fixed Quota Allocations (in tonnes). This directly causes wide spread discarding of marketable fish. 

Please see paper titled, How Government and Fisheries management policies caused over fishing in UK waters, on The British Fishing Industry Facebook page.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory from the age of 18
attributes.background: The turnouts for general elections are extremely low. On average only 60% of registered voters actually take part. The remaining 40% remain passive despite the fact that they're UK citizens and the outcome greatly affects not only them, but their family and friends.
attributes.additional_details: During the 2010 general elections the total UK citizens that voted amounted to just 65% . This shows that a significant amount of potential voters did not take part. The remaining 16 million registered could've hugely impacted the end result if they'd only bothered to vote.

attributes.action: Close the 6 US military bases in the UK.
attributes.background: Magna Carta guarantees the removal of foreign forces following the restoration of peace. In 1942, after Japan attacked Hawaii, American forces established bases in the UK to fight Nazi Germany. In 1945 Adolf Hitler killed himself. On 8 October 2017 American forces still occupied 6 bases in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: Magna Carta Clause (51) As soon as peace is restored, we will remove from the kingdom all the foreign knights, bowmen, their attendants, and the mercenaries that have come to it, to its harm, with horses and arms. https://militarybases.com/united-kingdom/ https://www.bl.uk/magna-carta/articles/magna-carta-english-translation

attributes.action: Cap costs! People should not be forced to sell their homes to pay for care.
attributes.background: Last year as many as 50000 pensioners were forced to sell their home to pay for care. In a survey, two thirds of people said they believed social care care payments should be shared between them and the Government. But nine in 10 want a solid cap on contributions from individuals.
attributes.additional_details: We believe that there should be an overall maximum an individual should ever face paying and that the Government should introduce a cap on care costs. The average cost of a care home place is £600 a week. If anyone needing support has capital, including the value of any property, or income above £23250, it is likely they will be liable for care fees. People should not be forced to sell their home to pay for care. It is time to cap care costs!

attributes.action: Tighter Regulations On Dog Breeding and Make Neutering and Spaying Compulsory
attributes.background: The country is awash with animals being dumped and abandoned, shelters are bursting at the seams. Healthy animals are being euthanised as there simply aren't enough homes available. Bitches are being bred repeatedly for financial gain. So called designer breeds were previously mongrels.
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment the rules states 2 KC registered litters per bitch, this can be overcome by registering extra females in a litter and using the extra papers on the original bitch.

There is no law regulating unscrupulous breeding.

1. Licence breeders, limiting the amount of breeding bitches per breeder, inspect regularly to maintain welfare and standards.
2. Spaying and neutering should be compulsory. Stop puppy farms and back yard breeders.
3. Tougher penalties for people in breach of the law.

attributes.action: Make homework voluntary for children
attributes.background: Homework should be voluntary as children with a high homework load often suffer from mental health problems such as anxiety and depression. The homework given to a child should be limited and not compulsory to allow time to relax, enjoy physical activities and to sleep.

attributes.action: Create a Devolved English Parliament
attributes.background: Scotland has the Scottish Parliament, Wales has the Welsh Assembly (soon to be Parliament) and Northern Ireland has the Northern Ireland Assembly. As the most populous country within the United Kingdom, England should also have a parliament to end the West Lothian Question.
attributes.additional_details: For too long England has had Scottish, Welsh, and Northern Irish MPs vote on matters that only affect England. It is time to have a devolved parliament to bring fairness and democracy to the region.

attributes.action: To make the wearing of a cycle helmet compulsory when cycling on public roads.
attributes.background: The increase and popularity of cycling has exploded over the past few years and brought thousands of cyclists onto our crowded roads and into conflict with other road users. The potential for accidents has increased and the potential for fatal head injuries.
attributes.additional_details: In 2015, 18,844 cyclists were injured in reported road accidents, including 3,339 who were killed or seriously injured. (Source ROSPA)

attributes.action: Amend the law to deal with repeated dog on dog attacks.
attributes.background: Under the Dangerous Dogs Act 1991, action can only be taken against a dog owner if their dog attacks a person or an assistance dog. I want to see this extended so that where a dog severely attacks other dogs (where they require vet treatment) that action can be taken by the police against the owner
attributes.additional_details: As a dog owner, whose dog has been attacked and put in the vets, I am horrified to hear and read about this same dog attacking other dogs. When these attacks are then reported to the police, owners are informed nothing can be done, as in is not detailed in the "dangerous dogs act". I feel strongly that this needs to change. I am not asking for dogs to be put down, but that they have to wear a muzzle in public. For me, this is part of being a responsible dog owner.

attributes.action: Abolish tuition fees
attributes.background: Charging students for a near-essential requirement for future employment is discouraging even the best and brightest students from furthering their education and achieving their full potential, leaving students in £36,000+ of debt before even starting work. Education is a right, not a privilege.
attributes.additional_details: With more people attending university than ever before and it becoming more and more necessary in order to succeed in the world of work, our young people are being left saddled by huge financial burdens that can often lead to anxiety among students. In modern Britain education should be a right and not just a privilege for those who can afford it. Even with measures which attempt to relieve this burden, the problems created by this debt can only be resolved in one way: abolishing them entirely.

attributes.action: A referendum on the ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
attributes.background:
There are continuous debates on the use of the Foreign Aid Budget, from many different sides. Lets have the people that earn / provide the money decide how it should be used, if we are to have one at all.
I suggest four choices: (5th if we use remaining monies for Elderly Care)
attributes.additional_details:
1.	Change nothing maintain the 0.7% of GDP on overseas aid
2.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government on using the 0.7% of GDP for anything else & all remaining monies to be ‘Foreign Aid Budget’
3.	Use monies to bring all public workers in line with current inflation; ban the government using the 0.7% of GDP all remaining monies to be spent on replacing the EU subsidies, based upon % share of monies provided by the EU
4. No Foreign Aid Budget

attributes.action: Don't close Parliamentary Petition system in the months surrounding an election
attributes.background:
Before and during the 2017 general election the Parliamentary Petition site closed. It was not reinstated until September, resulting in four months when citizens were denied a mechanism for raising concerns.

There is no reason why the mechanism for submitting or signing petitions should be closed
attributes.additional_details: Separate the running of the petitions site from the reviewing of petitions. The first should be available to citizens at all times (with the possible exception of during the actual election campaign), the second is reasonably the role of the petitions committee.

attributes.action: Bring back the nit nurse!
attributes.background: Its just been the summer holidays and some children have returned to school with head lice. Children as young as 4 and 5 are riddled with them. That cannot be comfortable in the slightest! If we brought back the nit nurse then i think it would benefit alot of kids and destroy the nasty critters!

attributes.action: End fines for parents who take their children on short holiday during term time.
attributes.background:
Since 2013 parents can be subject to criminal proceedings for taking their children on holiday during term times.

The current system exploits the law that was passed under the guise of dealing with repeated truancy. It is also indirectly discriminating against families based on class and income.
attributes.additional_details:
Two scientists (Dr. Beccy Smith and Alan Barr) have investigated the figures, separating the data for authorised term-time holidays from the broader dataset used by the government, which includes other absences such as those related to illness or exclusion.

They have concluded, independently, that authorised holiday absences are not linked to poorer attainment at KS2, and there is growing evidence to suggest this is the case across the stages.

attributes.action: Update BE test rules to allow automatic cars to be used and gain manual as well
attributes.background: The BE driving licence rules need to be updated to allow people that take the test in an automatic to gain manual entitlement if they hold manual Cat B licence, as this is proving difficult for Trainers to buy suitable test vehicles, as more and more car manufacturers are stopping making manual cars
attributes.additional_details:
The rules were changed to allow Cat C and CE candidates to pass a test in an automatic truck and gain manual entitlement if they hold a manual Cat B licence, as more and more trucks were being made in automatic only.
This is now happening with car manufacturers and proving to be a problem to trainers in our industry.
Automatic vehicles are now more fuel efficient than manual vehicles so I feel the rules must be changed swiftly to enable us to help with reducing emissions to help our planet

attributes.action: Provide tuition fee loans for all graduate medical students
attributes.background: The Government does not offer tuition fee loans for graduates studying a 5-year medical degree. This leaves graduate medical students having to decide between crippling debt or dropping out of their studies. Tuition fee loans would enable selection of students based on merit and not ability to pay.
attributes.additional_details:
Graduates bring valuable life experience to the medical profession but are currently being hindered from completing a medical degree due to the significant burden of paying £9250 per year in fees upfront without the option of a tuition fee loan.

The Government already offer tuition fee loans to those studying medicine as a first degree. However, in light of the chronic doctor shortages in the NHS, the Government should extend this support for studying undergraduate medicine as second degree.

attributes.action: Scrap the variable speed limits as a traffic calming measure on the M25
attributes.background: I feel the variable speed limits cause unnecessary traffic on the motorway, cause accidents and add extra stress to daily driving on the motorway, I understand when there is an accident or incident on the motorway it is necessary  but used as a 'traffic calming' measure' doesn't work.
attributes.additional_details: 90% of the time driving on the m25 there is a 60mph 50 and 40 limit imposed where drives slow down under the gantry to around 30mph which causes drivers to brake and further down turns into stand still, once national speed limit is in place the traffic is clear. this is guaranteed in the same places, almost every day in peak hours.

attributes.action: Make every workplace and school complete a mandatory yearly CPR training day.
attributes.background: Many people don't know how to perform a life saving procedure (CPR) due to no fault of their own, but due to their school or work areas not providing this training. I believe more lives will be saved if CPR training is an mandatory training session. I know many people would appreciate this training.

attributes.action: Introduce a national awareness day specifically against plastic in our seas.
attributes.background: People are increasingly aware of how plastic, in all forms, is endangering sea and marine life. It doesn’t decay, possibly for centuries and we’re adding millions of new tons every year. Soon there will be more plastic than life in the sea.
attributes.additional_details: A National Awareness Day is the answer; a day on which all anti-plastic in the sea organisations and individuals could come together to maximise awareness. Britain’s ties to the sea are strong (historical, cultural, economic, geographic) and it would be great if our Government was the first to announce such a national day. Having a National Awareness Day is a win, win, win; for the oceans, people and politicians. There is currently no anti plastic in the sea day, we need one.

attributes.action: People caught fly-tipping should have their vehicle(s) seized and crushed.
attributes.background: Fly-tipping is the illegal dumping of rubbish. It scars the landscape and costs millions to remove. I can't imagine anyone not being appalled at the level of fly-tipping in this country, apart from those who make money from the activity or those with no respect for their communities and environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Expanded wording of the Petition -
In addition to fines payable for fly-tipping, those found guilty of fly-tipping should have the vehicle(s) they own or vehicle(s) knowingly provided to them for the purpose of fly-tipping, seized and crushed. Perpetrators hiring or borrowing vehicles for the purposes of fly-tipping will pay the equivalent cost of crushing and replacing the said vehicle in addition to any fines imposed for the offence.

attributes.action: Allow parents to legally withdraw their child from SATs (NC tests).
attributes.background: Parents should be able to legally withdraw their child from SATs, if they recognise that their child is suffering from the detrimental effects of SATs, or that they simply do not want to subject their child to the unnecessary stress associated with such testing.
attributes.additional_details:
SATs at the end of a child's primary education serve no purpose other than to provide data with which to show a primary school's 'worth', and also perhaps on which secondary schools can base their unrealistic targets for GCSE grades. 
However, subjecting 10 and 11 year olds to such punitive testing is highly stressful and can be hugely demoralising. It has been reported that year 6 pupils have been known to suffer from insomnia and other stress-related conditions. Parents should have the choice.

attributes.action: Stop the cuts to mental health services in Gateshead and Newcastle.
attributes.background:
People are suffering poor mental health more and more and the most needy are being over looked.
Good mental health is as important as physical health and more cuts to north east mental health services will make more suffer.
May promised no cuts and she has gone back on that promise.

attributes.action: Law to reward public if they get proof of a driver illegally using mobile phone.
attributes.background: Police can't be everywhere to catch drivers who use their mobile phones whilst driving. This law rewards the public if they get irefutable video or photo evidence of the driver using a mobile while driving. The reward will be a proportion of the fine after successful prosecution.
attributes.additional_details: This would empower the public whilst detering potential offending drivers. Nobody would dare touch their phone while driving if they thought the person walking their dog, standing at the bus stop, cyclist with a helmet camera etc was watching and waiting for them to touch their phone. Evidence would be presented with a time, date and place to be admissable to the authorities with vehicle model, registration and driver clearly using their phone in a manner contravening current UK laws.

attributes.action: FREE Junior use of council sports fields/ pitches and a cap on the Adult price.
attributes.background:
Get the Government to make local sports fields/pitches owned by local councils FREE for use by junior sports teams (Under 18) and immediate Cap on the cost for Adult sport teams. 
Councils are looking to earn money Instead of keeping our society fit and healthy!
SAVE OUR CHILDREN'S HEALTH!
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds City Council’s Charges risen by 15.9% in 5 years.

2012/13 season... 
Adults: £521 per team, per pitch 
Junior: £191 per team, per pitch

2017-18 season current charges.. 
Adults: £604 per team, per pitch 
Junior: £221 per team, per pitch
Mini: £110 per team, per pitch

The prices charged for pitches in Leeds goes up most years', meaning less Children can get involved with their local sports club as the price becomes a barrier for some families, especially those on low incomes or benefits

attributes.action: Stop car Insurance Companies from increasing drivers for no fault accident claim
attributes.background: Make applying financial increases to driver insurance premiums who have been involved in an accident with a non-insured driver or in a no fault accident, illegal.
attributes.additional_details:
It is unreasonable and unjust that drivers whom are unfortunate in being involved in a no fault accidents, or those involved in incidents whereby the other driver is not insured; should suffer a financial increase on their own insurance premiums. 

We pay a huge amount of money to the Insurance sector to protect us against incidents where our vehicles are stolen or damaged. At the moment a no fault accident will attract a minimum of a 10.81% load on your premiums, how is this fair or just?

attributes.action: Ban prostitute review sites
attributes.background: There are sites where men review sex workers and their services. These sites are also a forum for online bullying, where they share personal details such as the real names of girls and their addresses, and nasty comments are all shared publicly for the world to see.

attributes.action: Make Animal Tested products more easily identifiable.
attributes.background:
The consumer should be able to easily identify products that are linked to animal cruelty so they do not purchase them unwittingly.
Stop Animal Cruelty Now!

attributes.action: Asthmatics should get free inhalers
attributes.background: Asthma is a condition that affects millions across the UK. Many asthmatics are admitted to hospital each year due to asthma. Asthmatics are forced to spend a large sum of money each month on medication.  If diabetics can get insulin for free then why can't asthmatics get free inhalers?

attributes.action: Police required by law to pursue suspects not wearing a helmet
attributes.background: Every day there is more and more crime on motorbikes/mopeds etc. If the people riding them aren’t wearing a helmet, they know that the police cannot pursue them. They are laughing and getting away with it. Enough is enough. If they're big enough to do the crime, they're big enough to take the risk.

attributes.action: Install safe and fit for purpose safety fences (crash barriers) on UK motorways.
attributes.background: Having served as a Motorway Patrol Police Officer with the Central Motorway Police Group from 1993 to 2001 I attended the scene of many Motorway Cross-Over Road Traffic Collisions resulting in multiple loss of life. The current design it breached too easily and is not fit for purpose. Change them.
attributes.additional_details: There has been and continues to be multiple media reports on this subject year in and year out.... The current centre reservation crash barrier design (safety fence) is not working and many lives are being lost as a result of this failure. I am one of many former police officers and current police officers who are alarmed and the inadequacy of the current design. Time to act now and protect people from this in my opinion far too often preventable carnage.

attributes.action: Teach life skills to students in secondary schools, e.g. managing money etc.
attributes.background: Our education system should be designed to equip school leavers for the world of work and beyond. Yet there are still many young people who don’t possess essential life skills including managing money, employment skills, managing mental health, LGBT inclusive sex education, first aid etc.

attributes.action: Equal pay for 16 to 21 year olds
attributes.background: People under 21 are paid less then people over 21 years old, even if they are doing the same job, but 16 year olds are allowed to get married, have kids and join the armed forces. From 18 you can drink in a pub and more importantly vote so why shouldn't you have equal pay?

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public&private holiday services to be under an ombudsman
attributes.background: Make it compulsory for providers of holidays whether it be a public or private service,to be under an ombudsman. This allows there to be a fair and impartial assessment of dispute cases to stop those acting independently from treating customers unfairly when they are not willing to negotiate.

attributes.action: Prevent any money being paid to the EU from Britain after March 2019.
attributes.background: Theresa May has no mandate to pay the EU after March 2019. Her mandate is only to give the block notice of leaving, then follow through on the procedure. The vote of the people must be respected in full.

attributes.action: Allow Tyler the Creator back into the UK
attributes.background:
Tyler, The Creator claims he has been banned from the UK.
The US rapper says he is not allowed to enter the country for "three to five years" because of lyrics he wrote in 2009.
The co-founder of hip-hop collective Odd Future has always attracted controversy.
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship, or societal sanction. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used. This right has been incorporated into the Human Rights Act in 1998 and is still used today.

attributes.action: To convert the United Kingdom's voting system, to a "DPR" voting system.
attributes.background: The current voting system (First Past the Post / FPTP) leaves voters with a vote that's underrepresented. It also means parties can have a higher total of votes than others, but less seats in Parliament; leading to disproportionality. We need a new voting system for everybody's vote to be included!
attributes.additional_details:
The government can replace the current voting system, with a modernised system - known as a "Direct Party and Representative Voting".

There would still be an MP representing each constituency, but it would be easier for them to tackle local issues. The results are clear, which makes them easier to analyse. The voting would be proportional, which means that there would be a fairer balance, in Parliament. Most importantly, every vote counts, which is not the case with the current voting system.

attributes.action: Halt the scrapping of HMS OCEAN.
attributes.background: HMS Ocean is a very versatile and potent warship which this country needs to keep in service (or build a replacement). Its value is not only as an assault ship but as a humanitarian support vessel.

attributes.action: Allow recovery agents to have a different colour beacons while working
attributes.background: I believe recovery operatives should be allowed to have a different colour beacon on their vehicles and also be allowed to use flashing red/white lights on the rear of vehicle
attributes.additional_details: Due to there being no restrictions on who can use Orange beacons people no longer take notice of them, we are in effect an emergency service working in one of the most dangerous locations. We should be respected and allowed the same safety of any emergency service who works in a high risk location.

attributes.action: Raise at the UN Security Council the  police violence against the Catalan people
attributes.background: The widespread police violence against civilians trying to hold a referendum vote today is an insult to democracy in Western Europe and requires a proper UK response. We have a Responsibility To Protect where a state allows its own people to be treated like this

attributes.action: To introduce an annual dementia screening test for everyone over the age of 45.
attributes.background: Dementia is the major cause of death in England and Wales and, due to the aging population and more awareness of this disease, is set to become the UK's biggest killer. Earlier diagnosis and treatment can slow down the disease and help to improve the sufferer's quality of life.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.alzheimers.org.uk/info/20056/our_care_and_cure_research_magazine/971/dementia_research_news_-_spring_2017/4

attributes.action: Make targeted adverts in public spaces illegal.
attributes.background: The advertising billboards in Piccadilly Circus, for the first time ever, will show different adverts depending on what car you drive and how you look, by scrutinising you using cameras hidden in the screen.  This corporate assault on consensus reality has no place in our democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
References:

(1) https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg23631483-400-giant-screen-in-piccadilly-circus-to-show-targeted-ads-based-on-cars/

(2)http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sciencetech/article-4988764/New-screen-London-s-Piccadilly-Circus-track-people.html

(3)https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/personalised-ads-delivered-by-the-billboard-that-s-got-its-eye-on-you-hrxwrrb3z

(4) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telescreen

attributes.action: Enable an ESA - Emotional Support Animal to be recognized as an Assistance Dog
attributes.background: I am wanting ESA (Emotional Support Animal) Service Dogs to be allowed to be recognized as an Assistance Service Dog along with Blind Guide Service Dogs.They should be allowed into restaurants/pubs/etc as they help people like myself who have Mental Health Issues/Mental Health Disabilities.
attributes.additional_details: I have panic attacks in my home and in public places. After I rescued Summer they aren't as bad or as common. When she knows something is wrong, she runs to me, sits down&begins licking me. The dog I rescued now helps with something I had to face several times a day. I need her with me in public places, just like others who need a Service Dog with them, we need to recognize ESA Service Dogs as Assistance Dogs too.

attributes.action: Make the provision of seat belts on ALL school transport compulsory
attributes.background: My son's school bus has been involved in 2 collisions in the space of 10 months.  On both occasions the school bus had no seat belts.  We want the law changed before there is a serious injury or death.  Allowing local councils to determine the transport specification leaves children at risk.
attributes.additional_details: The legislation in Wales has been changed to make seat belts in school transport compulsory, Scotland are currently petitioning government and are at stage 3 of the process (financial considerations).  It is totally unthinkable that children in England are being left at risk.
